alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Alleghany, north central Wilkes and southeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina through 215 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Doughton Park to Idlewild. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laurel Springs... Glendale Springs... Idlewild... and Doughton Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
